OUTLET_NAME: 2nd Life Media (Alamogordo Town News, New Mexico Conservative News)
TARGET_AUDIENCE: General,Women,LGBTQ+,Old People,Profession or Trade,Arts, Culture, Music
NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: Digital service part of a multiplatform service (including radio), Second Life publishes one to two medium length articles daily. They operate with one editor and one publisher. The news content is particualrlly relevant to Alamogodo and localizes New Mexico state politics through a conservative lens. There is factual reporting as well as opinion pieces. There is a comment section and links to their radio affiliate and social media. There is a robust community calendar informing residents of happenings around the area.
Information organ from Zuni Pueblo government. Limited in original journalism but perhaps instrumental in helping meeting Pueblo information needs.
Local site with limited original reporting.

An experienced bureau team covering state government, elections, natural disasters and other local news of national interest.

Boomtown is a a subscription based newsletter and newswebsite for Los Alamos. The articles are in depth and well researched. Full quotes are rarerly used. Reputable data and graphics are consistrntly used.  There are also photo journalism essays. The articles educate residents about serious issues that range from weather, car crashes, corruption, economic growth, wildlife, politics, and insurance. They publish roughly one to three times a month. There is a staff of four people currently.
OWNER: Founders/partners: Minesh Bacrania and Stephanie Nakhleh

OUTLET_NAME: Bravo Mic Communications (KOTS- AM 1230, KDEM-FM, KVLC-FM)
NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: Similar to sister stations KDEM and KVLC, KOTS' local news is run by a single person. News is frequent with around one to two brief items published per day. This station translates the stories into Spanish.
Full in Spanish website. Posts frequently ( almost daily ) on website and facebook covering local and national content. Website has option to view content on specific regions.
A local news station that covers city, county, and state news.
A weekly print and digtal news station that covers local Carlsbad news.
City operated cable access system offers local productions, government proceedings, etc.
OWNER: Community Access TV for Silver City

NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: The website provides lots of free articles from the print edition that are in-depth and reported with journalistic standards. The topics and sources are representative of the surrouding community. There are weekly updated obituaries on the website, as the paper publishes once a week.The website provides no information about the staff. Most content is original, there are also Grant High School student writers, op-eds, and press releases on the site. There is no comment section. There is link to a Facebook page that has been inactive for about 2 years.
Albuquerque news and politics produced as part of Citizen Media Group, which in 2025 merged City Desk ABQ and NM Political Report under the NM Reports banner.

The Cloudcroft publishes once or twice a week short articles and news relearses on upcoming events. There is little reporting or sourcing, most articles are guides, lists, updates, press releases modified by staff writer, and quick video explainers. The content varies from city council to depoartment of game and fish, wildlife and camping, local events, featuring local business owners, etc... Engament is strong as there are pieces encouraging readers to enage and explaining why and an explanation on the website on why the staff is passionate about providing local news to the community. The staff is four people and all content is original.
Print coverage by small staff focused on Corrales community.

Digital and multiplatform, original reporting by student journalists at NMSU. Campus and area focused. Includes broadcasts carried by NMSU licensed KRWG Public Media. MENTION REPLACES KOKOPELLI starting in 2024.
OWNER: New Mexico State University Department of Journalism and Media Studies

NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: The University of New Mexico's independent student outlet covering university, city and state news.

OUTLET_NAME: Global One Media (KSMX-FM, KRMQ-FM, KSEL-FM, KSEL-AM)
NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: Commercial station group serving Eastern New Mexico. Music based formats but includes a local news component.

TRANSLATION?: Yes - Other (sometimes, news releases come in English and Spanish, thus we do post occasionally in Spanish)
NEWS_CONTENT_REMARKS: The Grant County Beat is a free online newspaper. Articles are published at least once a day, sometimes up to four times a day. They are in-depth articles with original reporting. Topics cover a wide range from wildlife, to lawsuits, community events, the stateegislature, and city council/ union/ board meetings. The website also provides obituaries, news releases, government links, and editorials. The staff is comprised of about four people. There is an about page that provides the goals of the newspaper and the owners biography. There are bylines and photo captions. There is no comment section and a link to a mostly inactive facebook. Readers are encouraged to email the owner.
